managementResponses.response:
Valued Guest,

I am happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. We appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your wonderful experience with us.

review.title: Theater district hotel
review.reviewText: This historic hotel was a pleasant surprise.  I expected the rooms to be tiny, but was pleasantly surprised by the roominess of the entire property.  The front desk was able to accommodate our family with connecting rooms at the last minute.  The high ceilings and ornate lobby even impressed my teenage son.  Bathrooms could use some updating, but that would change the vintage feel.  We would book this hotel again!
review.locationRemarks: In the theater district (Orphium theater is accross the street).  Public transportation stops right in front of hotel.  Freeway close.

managementResponses.response:
Andres,

Thank you for your feedback. I apologize for the noise you experienced. We do offer rooms that may be quieter and further from the street. We appreciate you taking the time to bring this to our attention.

review.title: Not a fan
review.reviewText:
I guess is a San Francisco thing, but this hotel is really overpriced for what it is. I got a 2 double bed room as I was traveling with my two kids. The beds are tiny and with the noise (both hallways and outside) I so had a terrible night, didn't get any rest. 

The neighborhood has improved a bit but is still not pretty at night.

managementResponses.response:
Valued Guest,

Thank you for feedback. I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We have a concierge from 7a to 7p who is happy to direct guests to suggested nearby restaurants, attractions, etc.

review.title: Nice hotel, not-so-nice location.
review.reviewText: While the Hotel Whitcomb is a lovely hotel, it's location is not so desirable. I felt very leery about venturing out and was glad I wasn't alone. If you are not going to be walking around San Francisco, then I would definitely recommend this hotel. The rooms are small but comfortable and the hotel itself is very old-worldly and quaint.

managementResponses.response:
Valued Guest,

review.title: Close to downtown.
review.reviewText: Expected nicer , newer hotel,  apprears hotel has then same bed/mattress , Rugs, and decor from when it was first opened.

review.reviewText: Older hotel convenient location  Noisy air conditioner, sink broke during our stay but safe, clean and in our price range so overall decent.

review.title: Careful
review.reviewText: The hotel is a lovely old building so water pressure in the shower is minimal. Location is dicey- many homeless in the area

managementResponses.response:
Nat,

We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback. I am happy to hear our staff was helpful.

review.title: Great Historic Hotel but needs a good cleaning!
review.reviewText: The staff was great, location was great, the hotel was beautiful BUT the rooms need help! The floors needed vacuumed, (seriously try not to drop anything behind any of the beds or tables!!) the doors were covered with dirty hand prints, and we had no water pressure in our shower. There was hair in the shower, and on the floors!  I can't believe they can charge over $200 per stay!

managementResponses.response:
Valued Guest,

Thank you for providing us with insight. We work hard in making our guests happy and will look into this immediately.

review.title: Claustrophobic room with a dash of small bugs.
review.reviewText:
I had a one room with two beds. The room was very claustrophobic. The room had Windows but you could not open them. Was indeed desperate for fresh air. 

In addition, Couldn't use the shower do to a swarm of small bugs living and flying around everywhere in the bathroom. 

For only a one night stay -it was rough. Will I come back. No!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback! We will use it to enhance our future guests stays. We take the safety and security of our guests very seriously and make great efforts to ensure it. Reviews like this help us in our day to day operations! Thank you again, Robert J. Cruz

review.title: The hotel is nice for San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice in that it looks historical. The problem is that San Francisco is a craphole. If you can avoid this city. Avoid it. Tons of homeless, druggies, alcoholics all over the city streets. Not a safe city to visit. Nice hotel and great people if you have to go there.

managementResponses.response: Thank you very much for the positive feedback! City life can be quiet loud and we do our best to keep it quiet. Next time you book with Expedia and stay with us we can get you a room on a higher floor to get you as high up from that city noise as possible! Thank you again!

review.title: Very nice hotel. Really enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: Nice it is a little noisy but that is life in the. City

review.title: Dirty hotel, right in the ghetto
review.reviewText: Filthy, bugs in the shower and in the room, wallpaper peeling, very very small round, about 12 channels to watch, lousy view with construction workers that woke me up, and did I say smack dab in the middle of the ghetto

review.title: Not in the safest, nor cleanest area of SF.
review.reviewText: We paid a high rate at this hotel. It was completely set at the wrong price point, even though San Francisco is an expensive city. Pay 50 bucks more to stay somewhere nicer that is not in the homeless section of town. Not safe to walk through this area at night. Crack addicts and General homelessness right outside the door at all times. Such a poor representation of San Francisco at first arrival. The hotel staff is wonderful, very accommodating. They did not ask why I wanted to leave upon seeing the elevator or room.  I walked back down to change my reservation. The room itself was pleasant and clean, we stayed one night instead of two . Lots of young "hostel" European types as guests. Graffiti and wall panel missing in one of the elevators, dark and depressing hallways reminiscent of the SHINING. Old hotel that in its day I am sure was fabulous, but those days are gone.

managementResponses.response:
Helen,

Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate you taking the time to bring your concerns to attention.

review.title: Awful
review.reviewText:
Hated this hotel with a passion.
I was on a 5 week trip and out of all the hotels we stayed at this was by far the worst.
I have nothing good to say about it at all - it's disgusting.
Not worth the rating
No tourist should be encouraged to stay in this part of town, especially families. It was horrific.
The hotel seriously needs upgrading and a rethink of how it advertises itself.
It tarnished the end of our trip and I would never ever go back

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the feedback! We are glad you were able to enjoy some of the facilities offered by our partners. We will use this feedback to enhance the stay of our future guests. Thank you again!

review.title: Outside Lands Hotel Stay
review.reviewText: stayed here because my friends and I were going to the Outside lands festival at golden gate park. It was a 5 minute walk to the shuttle spot and a lot of the festival goers stayed there. The hotel is small older hotel and had a Starbucks attached to it which was convenient for the mornings. Wpuod recommend for how close it was to the shuttle but wouldn't recommend for a type cal stay in SF. It was bum central at night.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the feedback! We strive to give our guests the best possible experience. We are very sorry we didn't meet the mark with your stay. We will use this feedback to find ways to improve our service. Thank you again!

review.title: Not that great..
review.reviewText:
Where do I even begin !!  
 Staff was rude .. Parking employees disorganized and full of bad attitude, not very welcome .. They seem bother to work ...
Could not sleep , noise all around , ppl partying , construction and traffic keep me up !

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the feedback. The team will use this information to find ways to make our future guests experience a positive one. Thank you again for taking the time to fill out a review!

review.reviewText: Took too long to check-in.  Did not get the room type I reserved.  Room had no window, only one hand towel, had to pull TV away from wall to view from bed.  Could be a great property but not a good first impression.

managementResponses.response:
Fatty,

Thank you for your feedback. We work hard in making our guests happy.

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText: When we first booked the hotel room, it stated that the hotel room is a room with double full queen size beds and room with a view. The view we got was a white building across the street... I did not know that is considered a view nowadays. The room i stayed in was room 562 which was extremely small and the beds were barely full size.  I guess for SF that is considered rather large. The room states that it sleeps up to four people but only provides the room with 2 large white towels in the shower. The next morning when the cleaning crew came they knocked once and did not wait for people in the room to respond before entering. Perhaps that was our fault that we did not put the DO NOT DISTURB at 7AM sign on the door first. But seriously, as a courtesy, please at least wait a few seconds for people to answer before entering. Also, there was construction going on at the hotel so noises starts at 6AM. on the plus side, there is a Starbucks coffee on the first floor but don't expect free coffee for guests.
review.positiveRemarks: the price and check out is at 12PM. When you park there overnight, the parking is $43something but you can take ut the car anytime and leave at 3PM.
review.negativeRemarks: advertising- "room with a view" really should mean room with a view instead of a building next door.
review.locationRemarks: The location is not the greatest. We saw people shooting up and trying to rob CVS a few times within 3 block radius(this is during daytime).

managementResponses.response:
Miles, 

Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

review.title: Beautiful yet tired hotel.
review.reviewText: It's an old place and it shows. The building itself is gorgeous and there's a nice feel to the hotel, but it's outdated in many ways. The concierge was useless and the valet made me a bit nervous. I would stay again if they lowered their prices.
